member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.Bootstrapping.PartitionSynchronizer.CreateLeasesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String})
member.summary: Creates leases if they do not exist. This might happen on initial start or if some lease was unexpectedly lost. Leases are created without the continuation token. It means partitions will be read according to 'From Beginning' or 'From current time'. Same applies also to split partitions. We do not search for parent lease and take continuation token since this might end up of reprocessing all the events since the split.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions
member.summary: Options to control various aspects of partition distribution happening within instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.LeaseRenewInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets renew interval for all leases for partitions currently held by instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.LeaseAcquireInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval to kick off a task to compute if partitions are distributed evenly among known host instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.LeaseExpirationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval for which the lease is taken on a lease representing a partition. If the lease is not renewed within this interval, it will cause it to expire and ownership of the partition will move to another instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.FeedPollDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay in between polling a partition for new changes on the feed, after all current changes are drained.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.CheckpointFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency how often to checkpoint leases.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.LeasePrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets a prefix to be used as part of the lease id. This can be used to support multiple instances of instances pointing at the same feed while using the same auxiliary collection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.MaxItemCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items to be returned in the enumeration operation in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.StartContinuation
member.summary: Gets or sets the start request continuation token to start looking for changes after.
member.remarks: This is only used when lease store is not initialized and is ignored if a lease for partition exists and has continuation token. If this is specified, both StartTime and StartFromBeginning are ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (exclusive) to start looking for changes after.
member.remarks: This is only used when: (1) Lease store is not initialized and is ignored if a lease for partition exists and has continuation token. (2) StartContinuation is not specified. If this is specified, StartFromBeginning is ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.StartFromBeginning
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether change feed in the Azure Cosmos DB service should start from beginning (true) or from current (false). By default it's start from current (false).
member.remarks: This is only used when: (1) Lease store is not initialized and is ignored if a lease for partition exists and has continuation token. (2) StartContinuation is not specified. (3) StartTime is not specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.SessionToken
member.summary: Gets or sets the session token for use with session consistency in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.MinPartitionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum partition count for the host. This can be used to increase the number of partitions for the host and thus override equal distribution (which is the default) of leases between hosts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.MaxPartitionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of partitions the host can serve. This can be used property to limit the number of partitions for the host and thus override equal distribution (which is the default) of leases between hosts. Default is 0 (unlimited).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.DiscardExistingLeases
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether on start of the host all existing leases should be deleted and the host should start from scratch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.QueryPartitionsMaxBatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the Batch size of query partitions API.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedProcessorOptions.DegreeOfParallelism
member.summary: Gets maximum number of tasks to use for auxiliary calls.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.CheckpointFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the frequency of lease event. The event will trigger when either of conditions is satisfied.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.CheckpointFrequency.ExplicitCheckpoint
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether explicit checkpointing is enabled. By default false. Setting to true means changefeed host will never checkpoint. Client code needs to explicitly checkpoint via

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.CheckpointFrequency.ProcessedDocumentCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that specifies to checkpoint every specified number of docs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.CheckpointFrequency.TimeInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that specifies to checkpoint every specified time interval.

member.summary: The ChangeFeedEventHost is shutting down.

member.summary: The resource, such as database or collection was removed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.FeedProcessing.ChangeFeedObserverCloseReason.LeaseLost

member.summary: IChangeFeedObserver threw an exception.

member.summary: The context passed to events.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.FeedProcessing.ChangeFeedObserverContext.CheckpointAsync
member.summary: Checkpoints progress of a stream. This method is valid only if manual checkpoint was configured. Client may accept multiple change feed batches to process in parallel. Once first N document processing was finished the client can call checkpoint on the last completed batches in the row. In case of automatic checkpointing this is method throws.
member.exception: Thrown if other host acquired the lease or the lease was deleted

member.summary: Provides an API to run continious processing on a single partition of some resource. Created by after some lease is acquired by the current host. member.summary: The form of the Loupe Log.Write method we're using

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.Logging.LogProviders.LoupeLogProvider.ProviderIsAvailableOverride

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.Logging.LogProviders.LogMessageFormatter.SimulateStructuredLogging(System.Func{System.String},System.Object[])
member.summary:
Some logging frameworks support structured logging, such as serilog. This will allow you to add names to structured data in a format string: For example: Log("Log message to {user}", user). This only works with serilog, but as the user of LibLog, you don't know if serilog is actually used. So, this class simulates that. it will replace any text in {curly braces} with an index number.
"Log {message} to {user}" would turn into => "Log {0} to {1}". Then the format parameters are handled using regular .net string.Format.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedEventHost
member.summary: Simple host for distributing change feed events across observers and thus allowing these observers scale. It distributes the load across its instances and allows dynamic scaling: - Partitions in partitioned collections are distributed across instances/observers. - New instance takes leases from existing instances to make distribution equal. - If an instance dies, the leases are distributed across remaining instances. It's useful for scenario when partition count is high so that one host/VM is not capable of processing that many change feed events. Client application needs to implement and register processor implementation with ChangeFeedEventHost.
member.remarks: It uses auxiliary document collection for managing leases for a partition. Every EventProcessorHost instance is performing the following two tasks: 1) Renew Leases: It keeps track of leases currently owned by the host and continuously keeps on renewing the leases. 2) Acquire Leases: Each instance continuously polls all leases to check if there are any leases it should acquire for the system to get into balanced state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedEventHost.builder
member.summary: Default builder for the

member.param: Specifies location of the DocumentDB collection to monitor changes for.
Specifies location of auxiliary data for load-balancing instances of .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions
member.summary: Options to control various aspects of partition distribution happening within instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.LeaseRenewInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets renew interval for all leases for partitions currently held by instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.LeaseAcquireInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval to kick off a task to compute if partitions are distributed evenly among known host instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.LeaseExpirationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval for which the lease is taken on a lease representing a partition. If the lease is not renewed within this interval, it will cause it to expire and ownership of the partition will move to another instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.FeedPollDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay in between polling a partition for new changes on the feed, after all current changes are drained.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.CheckpointFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency how often to checkpoint leases.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.LeasePrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets a prefix to be used as part of the lease id. This can be used to support multiple instances of instances pointing at the same feed while using the same auxiliary collection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.IsAutoCheckpointEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the host will checkpoint leases automatically. When this is set to false, use ChangeFeedObserverContext.CheckpointAsync for manual control of checkpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.MinPartitionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum partition count for the host. This can be used to increase the number of partitions for the host and thus override equal distribution (which is the default) of leases between hosts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.MaxPartitionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of partitions the host can serve. This can be used property to limit the number of partitions for the host and thus override equal distribution (which is the default) of leases between hosts. Default is 0 (unlimited).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.DiscardExistingLeases
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether on start of the host all existing leases should be deleted and the host should start from scratch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.ChangeFeedHostOptions.QueryPartitionsMaxBatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the Batch size of query partitions API.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.PartitionManagement.ILease
member.summary: Represents a lease that is persisted as a document in the lease collection. Leases are used to: * Keep track of the progress for a particular Partition Key Range. * Distribute load between different instances of . * Ensure reliable recovery for cases when an instance of gets disconnected, hangs or crashes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.PartitionManagement.ILease.PartitionId
member.summary: Gets the partition associated with the lease.

member.summary: Gets or sets the host name owner of the lease. The Owner keeps track which is currently processing that Partition Key Range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.PartitionManagement.ILease.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the Timestamp of the lease. Timestamp is used to determine lease expiration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.PartitionManagement.ILease.ContinuationToken
member.summary: Gets or sets the Continuation Token. Continuation Token is used to determine the last processed point of the Change Feed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.PartitionManagement.ILease.Id
member.summary: Gets the lease Id.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.PartitionManagement.ILease.ConcurrencyToken

member.remarks: It can set new for all returned leases if needed, including currently owned leases.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.PartitionManagement.IRemainingWorkEstimator
member.summary: Used to estimate the pending work remaining to be read in the Change Feed. Calculates the sum of pending work based on the difference between the latest status of the feed and the status of each existing lease.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.PartitionManagement.IRemainingWorkEstimator.GetEstimatedRemainingWork
member.summary: Calculates an estimate of the pending work remaining to be read in the Change Feed in amount of documents in the whole collection.
member.returns: An estimation of pending work in amount of documents.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Documents.ChangeFeedProcessor.PartitionManagement.IRemainingWorkEstimator.GetEstimatedRemainingWorkPerPartitionAsync
member.summary: Calculates an estimate of the pending work remaining to be read in the Change Feed in amount of documents per partition.
member.returns: An array of an estimation of pending work in amount of documents per partitions.
